alert.note: Alert for Northern Columbia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 9:29PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Nassau, Baker, east central Columbia, northwestern Clay, western Duval, south central Camden, southeastern Ware and southeastern Charlton Counties through 1030 PM EDT... At 929 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Folkston to 9 miles northwest of Sanderson. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hilliard, Callahan, Jacksonville International Arpt, Taylor, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, Maxville, Cisco Gardens, Olustee and St. George. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
